text: hi I'm Alexander Payne director of
downsizing so we're about halfway
through the movie here and Matt Damon
plays a guy named Paul Safra a
good-hearted guy from Omaha who's now 5
inches tall and living in a community of
500 tall people and he's met a gal who
is taking him to the south side of the
community where the workers of the city
live and they lived the whole when
you're that small you have to be
segregated from the rest of the world
surrounded by a wall to keep out
critters and people who could do harm
and now he's about to be reawakened in
this image of going through a dark
tunnel into the wall and out into the
light kind of a symbolizing birth or
death and his eyes are about to be open
to a sight of this community he had no
idea existed so this is where presumably
a lot of illegal workers who work in
this kind of upscale Orlando like
community called leisure land live the
idea here is that there are too many of
them to live inside the town in the
worker housing so they have to house
them outside in this kind of bootleg
community and my co-writer Jim Taylor
and I thought that they might have taken
these old construction trailers and
turned them into big apartment buildings
lower class apartment builders for
workers our idea was that big people
would have gone into these things with
huge sheets of plywood and just created
these little apartments for people and
here we go inside we shot this at the
largest soundstage in North America it's
up in Toronto and we I was working with
visual effects for the first time in my
career at least to this extent and this
apartment building of sorts we built up
to level three and everything from level
3 on up including the ceiling is done
digitally although we had to shoot all
of those extras on all of the levels
individually because we wanted to have a
great sense of reality here on the big
normal sized TV which keeps people
entertained is a clip from a Cantinflas
movie
called Suba Ibaka that means go up go
down I thought the title was related to
the film and you can see that there's a
whole life inside of every one of these
these trailers they have their own
grocery stores their own nail salons
hair salons if you look at the walls
that was the grain of plywood as a five
inch tall person would see it was very
painstakingly constructed by the art
department crew and once this woman
leads him into her apartment the movie
takes a dramatically different turn
